templateTitle: Certificate TLS/SSL expiry for Windows Hosts
templateDescription:
Turn time forward and check whether your TLS/SSL certificates are valid.

## Motivation

Noticing the TLS/SSL certification expiry too late is one problem you can easily avoid by frequently checking your expiry dates. While observability tools already handle this job nicely, you can't know whether they are working in your environment.
With this experiment, you can turn the time forward to check whether your HTTPS endpoint works at a given date in the future. Additionally, you can configure one of the [observability integrations](https://hub.steadybit.com/extensions?tags=Observability) to validate your observability tool's alerting.

## Structure
First, we validate that the given HTTPS endpoint is working today. Next, we will travel with the Windows host in time to validate that the HTTPS endpoint continues to work on a given date. If the TLS/SSL certificate has already expired at that date, the HTTP check will throw failures.

## Warning
Please be aware that we will manipulate the time for a given Windows host. Applications running at that Windows host may struggle to deal with the change in the clock correctly, and you may experience other side effects.
